pullRequest.title: Minor cleanups for ES-specifics in core code.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description

Motivation and Context


This PR is doing two things:

Moving a subclassed ES request class from core to storage module
Moving ES specifics from ClusterIT to subclass of integration test
Renaming IndexHelper class to TimeRangeFilterQuery

How Has This Been Tested?



Screenshots (if appropriate):
Types of changes


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Refactoring (non-breaking change)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

Checklist:



 My code follows the code style of this project.
 My change requires a change to the documentation.
 I have updated the documentation accordingly.
 I have read the CONTRIBUTING document.
 I have added tests to cover my changes.

beforeCommit.message: Giving helper class a better name.

afterCommit.message: Giving helper class a better name.

nodes.bodyText: While TimeRangeFilterQuery is a much better name than IndexHelper I find that it implies an object that can instantiated instead of a static factory. How about RangeQueryUtil or RangeQueryFactory?

commit.message: Moving request class to storage module.
Moving ES specifics from `ClusterIT` to subclass.
Giving helper class a better name.
Renaming class in order to indicate it being a factory.

beforeCommit.message: Giving helper class a better name.

afterCommit.message: Renaming class in order to indicate it being a factory.
